pydra.core.saving package¶

Submodules¶

pydra.core.saving.threading module¶

class pydra.core.saving.threading.FrameThread(path: str, q: queue.Queue, frame_rate: float, frame_size: tuple, fourcc: str, is_color: bool = False, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.saving.threading.Thread

Thread for saving video data using opencv.

Parameters

  • path (str) – File path where video is to be saved.

  • q (queue.Queue) – Queue that contains serialized frame data.

  • frame_rate (float) – Frame rate at which video is to be saved.

  • frame_size (tuple (width, height)) – The width and height of the frames.

  • fourcc (str) – Compression codec.

  • is_color (bool (default is False)) – Whether frames are in color.

writer¶

The opencv video writer object.

Type

cv2.VideoWriter

cleanup()[source]¶

Releases the video writer object.

dump(source, frame)[source]¶

Saves frames.

Parameters

  • source (str) – The source of the video frames. Parameter not used and exists only for consistency with other classes.

  • frame (np.ndarray) –

setup()[source]¶

Creates the video writer object.

class pydra.core.saving.threading.IndexedThread(path, q, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.saving.threading.Thread

Thread for saving indexed data.

Data are stored in the data attribute and saved as a pandas DataFrame during cleanup. The data attribute is a nested dictionary. The top level contains the source of incoming data. The next level contains three keys: “time”, “index” and “data”. The “time” and “index” are lists; “data” is a dictionary of lists for each data parameter.

Parameters

  • path (str) – Csv file path where data is to be saved.

  • q (queue.Queue) – Queue that contains serialized indexed data.

data¶

Dictionary where incoming data are stored.

Type

dict

cleanup()[source]¶

Saves data to a csv file as a pandas DataFrame.

The output DataFrame has a single index, and a time column. Data values are stored in the columns, and are named source.param. This allows multiple workers to feed the same thread without causing namespace collisions.

dump(source, t, i, data)[source]¶

Sorts and places data into the data dictionary.

Parameters

  • source (str) – The source (i.e. worker name) of the data.

  • t (float) –

  • i (int) –

  • data (dict) –

setup()[source]¶

Initializes the data attribute.

class pydra.core.saving.threading.PipelineSaver(name: str, members: list)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for saving data from workers belonging to the same pipeline.

This class receives incoming data from the pydra saver object with a call to its update method. Class contains various threads, queues and caches for storing and saving data.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the pipeline.

  • members (list) – A list of worker object types that belong to the pipeline.

frame_q, indexed_q, timestamped_q

Queues data of different types for saving by different threads.

Type

queue.Queue

frame¶

A copy of the last frame received by the pipeline.

Type

np.ndarray

timestamps¶

A queue that stores timestamps of incoming frames. Used to compute an actual frame rate for data acquisition.

Type

deque

data_cache¶

A dictionary containing a copy of data received for workers.

Type

dict

fourcc¶

Codec for video compression.

Type

str

flush() → dict[source]¶

Returns and clears all cached data.

property frame_rate¶

Returns the actual frame rate of data acquisition.

property frame_size¶

Returns the (width, height) of the last frame received.

property is_color¶

Returns whether incoming frames are color.

class pydra.core.saving.threading.Thread(path: str, q: queue.Queue, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Base thread class for saving data.

Implements a run method. The run method calls setup, then enters a loop where the queue is continually checked for new data, which are then handled by a dump method. When an exit signal (that evaluates as False) is received, the loop exits and a cleanup method is called.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The path where data are to be saved.

  • q (queue.Queue) – Queue containing data.

cleanup()[source]¶
dump(*args)[source]¶
run()[source]¶

Method representing the thread’s activity.

You may override this method in a subclass. The standard run() method invokes the callable object passed to the object’s constructor as the target argument, if any, with sequential and keyword arguments taken from the args and kwargs arguments, respectively.

setup()[source]¶

class pydra.core.saving.Saver(pipelines: dict, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pydra.core.base.PydraObject, pydra.core.process.ProcessMixIn

Singleton Saver class that integrates and handles incoming messages from all workers.

Parameters

Logged messages from pydra objects.

Type

Type

Stores whether data are currently being saved.

Type

List that stores all PipelineSaver objects.

Type

list

A dictionary that maps data received from workers to the appropriate PipelineSaver object.

Type

exit(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Terminates the process loop.

handle_log(name, data, **kwargs)[source]¶

Handles logged messages.

The log is a list of messages sent within the pydra network. Each item in the log contains a timestamp when the message was sent, the source of the message, the name of the message, and the data contained within the message.

name = 'saver'¶
